mr: give_opinion(name[Guitar Hero: Smash Hits], developer[Beenox], rating[poor])
ref: Honestly, Guitar Hero: Smash Hits just wasn't engaging for me. I tend to avoid games by Beenox.

mr: give_opinion(name[Guitar Hero: Smash Hits], release_year[2009], rating[poor])
ref: Guitar Hero: Smash Hits just didn't do it for me. It really shows that it was made back in 2009.

mr: give_opinion(name[Guitar Hero: Smash Hits], esrb[T (for Teen)], rating[poor])
ref: I didn't like Guitar Hero: Smash Hits, it felt a little immature for a T rated game.

mr: give_opinion(name[Guitar Hero: Smash Hits], rating[poor], has_multiplayer[yes])
ref: Guitar Hero: Smash Hits felt kinda lacking to me. I think they focused too much on the multiplayer and ignored the rest.

mr: give_opinion(name[Guitar Hero: Smash Hits], rating[poor], player_perspective[first person])
ref: Guitar Hero: Smash Hits was pretty bad. The first person perspective was just too jarring.
I used to love World of Warcraft, I just wish it was available on Steam, that would be so convenient.

mr: give_opinion(name[World of Warcraft], developer[Blizzard Entertainment], rating[good])
ref: Blizzard Entertainment did a good job with World of Warcraft, I liked playing it.
I wish I could go back to 2004 when World of Warcraft first came out and I would spend hours playing.
World of Warcraft was good, but I think it could have been even more popular if they released the game on more than just PC.

mr: give_opinion(name[World of Warcraft], rating[good], genres[adventure, MMORPG])
ref: The adventure MMORPG style of World of Warcraft really made it something different, which I enjoyed.

mr: give_opinion(name[Age of Wonders II: The Wizard's Throne], developer[Triumph Studios], rating[poor])
ref: I really wanted to like Age of Wonders II: The Wizard's Throne, but Triumph Studios made it and I end up hating all of their games.

mr: give_opinion(name[Age of Wonders II: The Wizard's Throne], rating[poor], genres[role-playing, turn-based strategy])
ref: Role-playing games that are turn-based strategy are all played out. Take for example Age of Wonders II: The Wizard's Throne; it's so boring.

mr: give_opinion(name[Age of Wonders II: The Wizard's Throne], rating[poor], has_mac_release[no])
ref: I really hated that Age of Wonders II: The Wizard's Throne didn't have a version for Mac. I had to borrow my brother's laptop to play.

mr: give_opinion(name[Age of Wonders II: The Wizard's Throne], rating[poor], player_perspective[bird view])
ref: I absolutely hate bird view perspective games like Age of Wonders II: The Wizard's Throne. I can't even see what my character is doing.

mr: give_opinion(name[Age of Wonders II: The Wizard's Throne], release_year[2002], rating[poor])
ref: I hate playing older games like Age of Wonders II: The Wizard's Throne. It's from 2002, why not play something new?
I thought Far Cry 3 was pretty good. I have a thing for first person perspective games.
Action-adventure shooter games are fun, and Far Cry 3 was a good one that scratched my itch.
PlayStation has had a lot of interesting and expanding games, and Far Cry 3 was one of those good ones.
One thing I thought that makes Far Cry 3 a pretty good game is that it has multiplayer as well. It has a great single-player campaign, but you can jump online and enjoy it that way too.
Far Cry 3 was a pretty good game for 2012.

mr: give_opinion(name[Silent Hill 2], developer[Konami Computer Entertainment Tokyo], rating[excellent])
ref: Konami Computer Entertainment Tokyo makes the best games. One of my favorites is Silent Hill 2.
Third person games like Silent Hill 2 are the best. First person is too close and bird's eye is too far.
PC is the best platform because we get games like Silent Hill 2.
Action-adventure puzzle games like Silent Hill 2 are great. You get to work your reflexes and your brain too.
All of my favorite games are rated M, like Silent Hill 2. I don't even bother with other games anymore.
I love playing games by tobyfox, they're so fun. Take Undertale, for example.
Adventure role-playing games are my favorite, especially indie ones like Undertale.
I always love the bird's eye view in games because it's so easy to see everything - such as in games like Undertale.
With its great single-player campaign, I can enjoy playing Undertale any time.
I really like when E rated games come out, for example, I can watch even my youngest nephews play Undertale.

mr: give_opinion(name[Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris], esrb[T (for Teen)], rating[average])
ref: You could tell Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris was rated teen. Just cool enough to not be for kids and just mediocre enough to not be for adults.

mr: give_opinion(name[Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris], rating[average], player_perspective[bird view])
ref: I had mixed feelings about the bird view in Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris, I felt like it kind of disconnected me from the game.

mr: give_opinion(name[Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris], rating[average], genres[action-adventure, puzzle, shooter])
ref: As an action-adventure puzzle shooter, Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris had a lot going on. It pulled it off but it's not great.

mr: give_opinion(name[Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris], rating[average], has_multiplayer[yes])
ref: It's the multiplayer that made Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris a decent game. Without it, it would have been even worse.

mr: give_opinion(name[Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris], developer[Crystal Dynamics], rating[average])
ref: I usually like stuff by Crystal Dynamics, but Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris just felt mediocre.
I finished Quantum Break but, man, for an adventure shooter it was just OK.
Man, 2016 was such a good year for games, but Quantum Break was just middle-of-the-road.
I've never played a game from Remedy Entertainment that I really loved. Take Quantum Break, for example, it's decent but not great.
Quantum Break would have been so much better with multiplayer. I really prefer playing with other people, you know?
I like third person player perspective games, but Quantum Break felt like it might have been better in first person. As it was, I only kinda liked it.

mr: give_opinion(name[Mirror's Edge Catalyst], rating[poor], genres[action-adventure, fighting])
ref: I can never get into action-adventure fighting games like Mirror's Edge Catalyst, there's just too much going on there.
I wish I could play Mirror's Edge Catalyst, but I'm a Mac guy and it wasn't released for this system.
I hate when games like Mirror's Edge Catalyst come with multiplayer, as the single-player then tends to be lacking in depth.
Ah, I wish Mirror's Edge Catalyst was on Steam, they're the only game source I trust to be legit.

mr: give_opinion(name[Mirror's Edge Catalyst], rating[poor], player_perspective[first person])
ref: I avoid first person perspective games like Mirror's Edge Catalyst, it can become somewhat nauseating.
I feel like EA Tiburon didn't do quite a great job developing Madden NFL 15.
Madden NFL 15 felt like an only average entry, released back in 2014.
Madden NFL 15 uses a bird's eye view, which is OK considering its average graphics.
Although Madden NFL 15 supports multiplayer, it wasn't enough to make it any better than average.
Having played Madden NFL 15 on Xbox, I found the controls and graphics mediocre.
